body_html:
There is no output, it just hangs after the print line and starts eating up memory.

I just tried replacing batch_norm with layer_norm, which doesn't have an is_training parameter at all - no luck, still eats up all the memory.

It's also worth mentioning that the exact same code runs successfully on an AWS P2 server which has tensorflow 1.3 installed.

body:
There is no output, it just hangs after the `print` line and starts eating up memory.

I just tried replacing `batch_norm` with `layer_norm`, which doesn't have an `is_training` parameter at all - no luck, still eats up all the memory.

It's also worth mentioning that the exact same code runs successfully on an AWS P2 server which has tensorflow 1.3 installed.
